messages.content: What is the ComfyUI Embedding Picker custom node used for?
The ComfyUI Embedding Picker custom node is used to easily remember and use various embedding names by automatically inserting them into prompts.
What are the available ways to install the ComfyUI Embedding Picker?
The ComfyUI Embedding Picker can be installed via direct download from the 'Code' button pop-up window or by cloning the repository using `git clone` into the `custom_nodes` directory.
How should the default prompt structure look like when using the ComfyUI Embedding Picker?
By default, the prompt structure when using the ComfyUI Embedding Picker looks like `embedding:EasyNegative.pt, text, watermark`.
What is the purpose of the 'append' parameter in the ComfyUI Embedding Picker?

The 'append' parameter is used to adjust the placement of the embedding in the prompt. Setting it to True will place the embedding at the end of the prompt, forming a structure like `text, watermark, embedding:EasyNegative.pt`.
What type of custom node is the ComfyUI Embedding Picker?
The ComfyUI Embedding Picker is a custom node designed to extend the functionality of ComfyUI for better embedding management.
How can you quickly chain multiple embeddings using the ComfyUI Embedding Picker?

You can quickly chain multiple embeddings by either selecting the top option 'Prepend Embedding Picker' on the _CLIP Text Encode_ node or by using the similar option available on the `Embedding Picker' node itself.
What is the difference between an 'append' value of False and True in the ComfyUI Embedding Picker?

An 'append' value of False in the ComfyUI Embedding Picker places the embedding at the beginning of the prompt, forming a structure like `embedding:EasyNegative.pt, text, watermark`. On the other hand, an 'append' value of True places the embedding at the end of the prompt, forming a structure like `text, watermark, embedding:EasyNegative.pt`.
